main_definition: Having permanently stopped work, typically due to reaching a certain age or after serving in the military.

meanings_and_examples.definition: No longer actively working, especially due to old age or completion of one's career.
meanings_and_examples.example: After 30 years as an engineer, John finally retired and decided to travel the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having ceased involvement in a particular activity, role, or position for good reasons such as age or fulfillment of duties.
meanings_and_examples.example: The professor announced that he would be retiring from teaching after this semester to pursue his passion for painting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Surrendering a military rank or status upon leaving the armed forces, usually due to reaching mandatory retirement age.
meanings_and_examples.example: After 20 years of service in the Army, Sergeant Brown was honorably retired and no longer held his commission.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not currently working or seeking employment, often for a temporary period due to various life circumstances.
meanings_and_examples.example: Due to family commitments, Sarah has been on a hiatus from her job, effectively in a retirement-like state until she can resume full time work.
